name: nonlinear
content:
nonlinear adjective
(LINES)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not consisting of or relating to lines: His galleries have a nonlinear arrangement, and paintings are hung at different heights along the sloped walls. The object follows a non-linear trajectory.
More examplesFewer examplesThey added power bands along the arms and shoulders to enhance forward arm swing and minimize non-linear motion.

nonlinear adjective
(ORDER)
involving events or thoughts in which one does not follow another one directly: Many films incorporate nonlinear storytelling. Non-linear thinking is increasingly valued by corporations.
More examplesFewer examplesHe says that using verse allows for non-linear jumps in plot.Learning naturally develops in non-linear, branching ways.

nonlinear adjective
(MATHEMATICS & SCIENCE)
science
  specialized involving a situation in which one thing does not change at the same rate as another, so that the relationship between them changes : A nonlinear relationship was observed between the changes in the glucose and sodium concentrations.
mathematics
  specialized A nonlinear equation (= mathematical statement) describes a situation in which one thing does not change at the same rate as another, so that the relationship between them changes. Nonlinear equations have the form of curves, rather than straight lines, on a graph: A nonlinear equation describes a process in which consequences are not proportional to causes.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is a fundamental characteristic of non-linear systems that small variations in starting conditions have disproportionate effects on the outcome over time.

nonlinear adjective
(EDITING)
media, theatre & film
  specialized Nonlinear editing is a method of editing video, images, or audio (= sound) files by going directly to the part of the file you want to edit, rather then working through each part of the file in order: Nonlinear editing involves the manipulation of digitized video.
